components/esm/loadmgef.hpp

00001 #ifndef _ESM_MGEF_H
00002 #define _ESM_MGEF_H
00003 
00004 #include "esm_reader.hpp"
00005 
00006 namespace ESM {
00007 
00008 struct MagicEffect
00009 {
00010   enum Flags 
00011     {
00012       SpellMaking = 0x0200,
00013       Enchanting  = 0x0400,
00014       Negative    = 0x0800 // A harmful effect. Will determine whether
00015                            // eg. NPCs regard this spell as an attack.
00016     };
00017 
00018   struct MEDTstruct
00019   {
00020     int school; // SpellSchool, see defs.hpp
00021     float baseCost;
00022     int flags;
00023     // Properties of the fired magic 'ball' I think
00024     int red, blue, green;
00025     float speed, size, sizeCap;
00026   }; // 36 bytes
00027 
00028   MEDTstruct data;
00029 
00030   std::string icon, particle,   // Textures
00031     casting, hit, area,         // Statics
00032     bolt,                       // Weapon
00033     castSound, boltSound,
00034     hitSound, areaSound,        // Sounds
00035     description;
00036 
00037   // Index of this magical effect. Corresponds to one of the
00038   // hard-coded effects in the original engine:
00039   // 0-136 in Morrowind
00040   // 137 in Tribunal
00041   // 138-140 in Bloodmoon (also changes 64?)
00042   // 141-142 are summon effects introduced in bloodmoon, but not used
00043   // there. They can be redefined in mods by setting the name in GMST
00044   // sEffectSummonCreature04/05 creature id in
00045   // sMagicCreature04ID/05ID.
00046   int index;
00047 
00048   void load(ESMReader &esm)
00049   {
00050     esm.getHNT(index, "INDX");
00051 
00052     esm.getHNT(data, "MEDT", 36);
00053     icon = esm.getHNOString("ITEX");
00054     particle = esm.getHNOString("PTEX");
00055 
00056     boltSound = esm.getHNOString("BSND");
00057     castSound = esm.getHNOString("CSND");
00058     hitSound = esm.getHNOString("HSND");
00059     areaSound = esm.getHNOString("ASND");
00060 
00061     casting = esm.getHNOString("CVFX");
00062     bolt = esm.getHNOString("BVFX");
00063     hit = esm.getHNOString("HVFX");
00064     area = esm.getHNOString("AVFX");
00065 
00066     description = esm.getHNOString("DESC");
00067   }
00068 };
00069 }
00070 #endif
